news_header: Three former Harrods employees accuse Ali Fayed of sexual assault during the 1990s, while he and his brothers owned the department store. Fayed denies all allegations.
news_original_title: Surviving Al Fayed brother accused of sexual assaults
news_text: Three women who previously worked at Harrods have publicly accused Ali Fayed, brother of Mohamed Al Fayed, of sexual assault occurring in the 1990s. The women allege that the assaults took place in various locations, including London and the US, while they were employed at the department store. Ali Fayed, now 82, has denied the allegations through a spokesperson, asserting that he will not be scapegoated and that the incidents never occurred. The accusations follow a pattern of alleged abuse by both Ali and his brother Mohamed, with police reporting that over 100 women have made allegations against Mohamed. The women are seeking justice and have initiated civil legal action against Harrods.
